data: Respondents were asked if they had ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that they had a cancer or malignancy of any kind. They were then asked to name the kind of cancer they had. Respondents who had skin (melanoma), skin (non-melanoma), or skin cancer (unknown kind) where classified as having any skin cancer.

caption: Percentage of skin cancer for adults aged 18 and over (95% confidence intervals), United States
